articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Nick Babich)
articles.description: Letâ€™s take a closer look at how you can create your very own WordPress site up and running created and hosted with the Elementor Cloud Website.
articles.title: The Modern Way To Create And Host A WordPress Site

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Drew McLellan)
articles.description: In this episode, we ask how one man can go from designing websites for local bands to heading up Google Fonts Knowledge. Smashingâ€™s Vitaly Friedman talks to Elliot Jay Stocks to find out.
articles.title: Smashing Podcast Episode 46 With Vitaly Friedman: Who Is Elliot Jay Stocks?

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Sean Roberts)
articles.description: What makes the underused `Server-Timing` header uniquely powerful among all other response headers? Weâ€™ll rethink the expectation for using it exclusively for timing and see fast solutions for hard-to-solve monitoring challenges.
articles.title: Rethinking Server-Timing As A Critical Monitoring Tool

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Gerry McGovern)
articles.description: We waste so much today. One way of focusing on what truly matters is by identifying Top Tasks for yourself. Learn how to make tough decisions by focusing on the real, quantifiable evidence that will help create a better experience for your users.
articles.title: Top Tasks: To Focus On What Matters You Must De-Focus On What Doesnâ€™t

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Dan Shappir)
articles.description: In this article, Dan Shappir analyzes the performance cost associated with various frameworks and explains the wide variety of framework and platform choices that are currently available to front-end and fullstack developers.
articles.title: How To Use Google CrUX To Analyze And Compare The Performance Of JS Frameworks

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Denis Studennikov)
articles.description: In this article, we will be taking a closer look at a design case study and discuss possible reasons why its customers abandon their online shopping carts and what solutions are recommended in each particular case.
articles.title: How Even Small UX Changes Can Result In An Increase In Conversion (A Case Study)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: Smart SVG techniques, from generative SVG grids to SVG paths with masks, grainy SVG gradients, cut-out effects and fractional SVG stars. Letâ€™s look at some magical SVG techniques that you can use right away.
articles.title: Magical SVG Techniques

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Barry Pollard)
articles.description: At the end of 2021, the Chrome team shipped some functionality that has the ability to make or break sites meeting the Core Web Vitals. So, letâ€™s learn a little bit more about the Back/Forward Cache (aka bfcache), and what you can do to test if your website is compatible with it.
articles.title: Performance Game Changer: Browser Back/Forward Cache

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Joshua Mauldin)
articles.description: Letâ€™s explore how to give and receive better feedback when working remotely â€” feedback that is actionable, specific, kind, and that wonâ€™t set you on edge. Weâ€™ll start by explaining when feedback sessions donâ€™t work and how to prevent it.
articles.title: How To Give Effective Feedback Remotely

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Stefan Baumgartner)
articles.description: When deploying websites, thereâ€™s rarely a one-size-fits-all solution. Some websites benefit from server-rendered pages, some prefer statically generating content upfront. articles.title: Resilience, Flexibility And Immediacy: Working With Headless Systems

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: How difficult can it be to design a bulletproof language selector? Itâ€™s not as straightforward as one might think. We need to avoid redirects, decouple our language and country presets, allow for overrides, and use non-modal windows. Letâ€™s dive in!

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Josh Comeau)

articles.title: How Partytown Eliminates Website Bloat From Third-Party Scripts

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Nathan Smith)

articles.title: CTA Modal: How To Build A Web Component

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: We should be able to measure how well a particular design solves a particular problem. Letâ€™s explore design KPIs that capture userâ€™s experience, how to measure them and how to keep both users and business stakeholders happy, over time.

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Ceara Crawshaw)
articles.description: When bad UX has lingered in a product for so long, it can feel like a mountain to overcome. In this article, Ceara Crawshaw shares her advice on how you can invoke joy and assure the quality in the work done on product teams.
articles.title: Preventing Bad UX Through Integrated Design Workflows

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Jhey Tompkins)
articles.description: In this article, Jhey Tompkins explores one of GreenSocksâ€™ newest plugins alongside React to create an impractical whimsical spin on a well-known native element: ``.
articles.title: What If Our Sliders Actually Slid?

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Georgy Marchuk)
articles.description: Have you ever wondered, why do people write CLI tools? When is a good time to think about yours? articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: In UX, we can use navigation queries, evaluation journeys, A-Z index and tap-ahead autocomplete to help users get where they want to be, faster. Letâ€™s find out how.

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
